adjective.description: (of one or more things) available as another possibility.
examples: the various alternative methods for resolving disputes
the alternative definition of democracy as popular power

noun.description: One of two or more available possibilities.
examples: audiobooks are an interesting alternative to reading
she had no alternative but to break the law

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense alternating, alternate): from French alternatif, -ive or medieval Latin alternativus, from Latin alternare interchange (see alternate).
